intro: Microrhynchus patens, commonly known as the small-beaked flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal spikes. It is often found in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
